intro: Maesa perakensis, commonly known as the Java maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
